body.directions: Listen to the audio; then, complete the multiple choice questions that follow.

body.quiz: Which of the following cannot be placed after the word in the audio?
body.correct: Wonderfully done! 每 měi means "every," and it can be followed by a time unit to form phrases such as "every day," "every year," or "every week." But you may not want to say "今天 jīntiān (every today)."
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the audio again, think about its meaning, and then combine each word in the choices with it to see which one doesn’t fit.

body.quiz: Which of the following words does not contain the same initial as the word in the audio?
body.correct: Outstanding work! 天 tiān (day) has the initial 't,' which is not in the word 字典 zìdiǎn (dictionary).
body.incorrect: So close! Listen again and identify the initial of the single-character word in the audio; then sound out the pinyin of the words in the choices to see which one does not have the same initial.

body.quiz: Which of the following hand gestures for numbers is best associated with the word in the audio?
body.answer: Hand gesture for number seven
options: Hand gesture for number six
Hand gesture for number eight
Hand gesture for number nine
body.correct: Totally awesome! 星期xīngqī means "week." It can be best associated with the number seven(seven days in a week), which is represented by the secondhand gesture in the choices.
body.incorrect: Not quite…think about the meaning of the word in the audio, and then consider what number can be best used to describe it and which hand gesture in the choices represent it.

body.textVersion: Audio for 开始 kāishǐ (to start)

body.quiz: Which of the following is a antonym (word with opposite meaning) of the word in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 结束 jiéshù
options: Audio for 需要 xūyào
Audio for 需要 qìngzhù
Audio for 喜欢 xǐhuān
body.correct: How wonderful! 开始 kāishǐ means "to start," and its antonym (word with opposite meaning) should be 结束 jiéshù (to end).
body.incorrect: Oops…listen to the audio several more times to identify the word’s meaning, and then consider which word of the choices has the opposite meaning.
